title: Founding of Rome (legend)
description: Romulus and Remus mythically found Rome on the Palatine Hill; traditional date for the city's founding.

title: Roman Republic Established
description: Romans overthrew the last king and established the Republic, creating institutions like the Senate and consular system.

title: Punic Wars
description: Series of wars between Rome and Carthage, including Hannibal's campaign; Rome's victory secured dominance in the western Mediterranean.

title: Julius Caesar & End of Republic
description: Caesar's crossing of the Rubicon, civil war, and eventual assassination led to the end of the Roman Republic.

title: Augustus & The Principate
description: Octavian (Augustus) became Rome's first emperor; established the principate and the Pax Romana—a long period of relative stability.

title: Pax Romana (peak)
description: Under Trajan, the empire reached its greatest territorial extent; era of relative peace, infrastructure, and cultural flourishing.

title: Constantine & Christianity
description: Constantine legalized Christianity and moved the capital to Constantinople, reshaping the religious and political landscape of the empire.

title: Sack of Rome (Visigoths)
description: The sack of Rome by Alaric's Visigoths marked a symbolic blow to Roman prestige in the West.

title: Fall of Western Roman Empire
description: Romulus Augustulus deposed; often marked as the end of the Western Roman Empire and the beginning of the Middle Ages in Western Europe.
